p: COVID-19 can predispose to venous and arterial thromboembolic disease as a result of excessive inflammation, hypoxia, immobilization and diffuse intravascular coagulation ( 1). Exact knowledge of the incidence of thrombotic complications in COVID-19 patients is important for decision making regarding the intensity of thromboprophylaxis, especially in ICU patients who are at higher risk for thrombosis.
